result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha Anne Babcock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Samantha Anne Babcock is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Samantha Anne Babcock was found guilty of Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).
  • Samantha Anne Babcock was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Samantha Anne Babcock was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Samantha Anne Babcock was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:29 AM Attorney Brenda Yaskal appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Samantha Anne Babcock appeared in court in custody from the Columbia County Jail, Attorney Taylor M Hart appeared in court for the defendant. Statement by Atty Yaskal re: revocation of the DPA to count 1. Sentencing recommendations/arguments by counsel. Statement by defendant. Court revoked the DPA to count 1, ordered defendant to serve 12 months jail w/Huber to commence forthwith, pay costs in the amount of $518.00 in 60 days or set up payment plan, submit DNA sample. 19 days credit. May serve in Marquette County. 9:45 AM

Deferred Prosecution Agreement filed.

Defendant Samantha Anne Babcock in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading waived on Amended Information.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1, 2,3,4. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Deferred Prosecution Agreement accepted. Count one held open under the Deferred Prosecution Agreement. Court sentenced defendant on counts 2,3,4 to 30 days jail on each count, concurrent with each other, may transfer to Marquette County Jail, commencing 1/29/17 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules.. $443, $243, $243 costs. Submit DNA sample.  Remainder of counts dismissed. Jail credit: 4 days.
